Poojan Shah

About Me

I am a 3rd year undergraduate student at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering of the Indian Insitute of Technology Delhi . I enjoy thinking about problems broadly related to theoretical CS.

I will be spending the winter semester of 2025 as an exchange student at the Faculty of Mathematics of the University of Waterloo.

Contact : \(\mathtt{cs1221594@iitd.ac.in}\)

Research

I am currently exploring algorithms for clustering problems and applications of the Continuous Learning with Errors problem (Report).

During much of 2024, I explored an algorithmic famework based on the dequantization of Quantum Machine Learning and subsequently worked on Quantum (Inspired) algorithms for clustering problems.

preprint : Ragesh Jaiswal and Poojan Shah. Quantum (Inspired) \(D^2\)-sampling with Applications

I spent the summer of 2024 as a research intern at the Computer Science Group of the Center for Quantum Technologies during which I explored quantum cryptography (Training Diary).
